name: Finale Performance Assessment
summary: Learn about .FPA files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: MakeMusic Finale is a popular music notation program used by composers and other musicians. Some previous versions of the app included a Performance Assessment tool that allowed musicians to play along with a piece of sheet music, record themselves performing the song, and review their performance.

The performance assessments Finale created were saved as FPA files. Each FPA file contains a copy of the sheet music a musician played along with, with notes the musician played accurately highlighted in green and notes the musician missed highlighted in red.
NOTE: Finale Performance Assessment was discontinued with the release of Finale 2007.

instructions: You can open an FPA file with MakeMusic Finale (Windows, Mac). To do so, select File â†’ Open... from the program's menu bar. Then, navigate to and open your FPA file.
